summary_reasoning: Explicitness: The report states most key drivers near the forecasts they inform (revenue CAGR 11.5%, 2025 revenue growth ~12.5%, operating margin path, WACC 9.8%, terminal growth 4.0%, share count -3.5%), and ties them to the DCF and EPS bridge. Specificity: Assumptions include magnitudes, units, and horizons (2025–2029), with clear sub-drivers for revenue (cross-border, value-added services). Consistency: Figures largely reconcile between narrative and the forecast table; minor differences (e.g., margin to ~59.5% vs 59.8% in 2029) are not material. Justification: Partially supported—WACC inputs cite the 10Y Treasury and Kroll ERP; revenue sub-drivers reference Q1-2025 trends and 2024 segment growth, and management guidance. However, terminal growth (4.0%), after-tax cost of debt (3.65%), and the margin expansion trajectory lack rigorous evidence/peer benchmarking, and the 3.5% share count reduction is assumed without price/authorization cadence detail. Sensitivity: No quantified sensitivity or scenario analysis on material levers (revenue growth mix, margins, WACC, terminal growth, buybacks), which triggers a cap at Fair. Several material DCF inputs (tax rate, capex/working capital drivers) are not articulated, leaving parts of free cash flow formation opaque.

assumptions_extracted.quote: We forecast a five-year revenue CAGR of 11.5% through 2029.
based on our ~12.5% revenue growth forecast for 2025.

location.section: Fair Value and Profit Drivers – Earnings Per Share (EPS) Bridge

assumptions_extracted.quote: This segment is forecast to be the fastest-growing part of the business, with mid-teens annual growth.

location.section: Fair Value and Profit Drivers – Revenue and Profit Drivers (Value-Added Services Expansion)

assumptions_extracted.quote: Cross-Border volume growth is expected to moderate ... to a sustainable high-single-digit rate

location.section: Fair Value and Profit Drivers – Revenue and Profit Drivers (Cross-Border Recovery Normalization)

assumptions_extracted.quote: We project adjusted operating margins will expand modestly from 58.4% in 2024 to approximately 59.5% by the end of the forecast period.
assumes a weighted average cost of capital (WACC) of 9.8%
Share Repurchase Contribution: ~$0.55 per share, assuming a net share count reduction of approximately 3.5%.

location.section: Fair Value and Profit Drivers – Earnings Per Share (EPS) Bridge

unjustified_parameters: Terminal growth rate 4.0% without detailed support
After-tax cost of debt 3.65% without source/derivation
Operating margin expansion to ~59.5% lacks peer/history benchmarking
Share count reduction of ~3.5% not tied to authorization pacing/assumed repurchase price
